intro: Verticordia monadelpha var. callitricha, commonly known as the golden wattle or the narrow-leaved verticordia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
